**Red Dog Mine** is a [census-designated place](/wiki/Census-designated_place
"Census-designated place") (CDP) in the [Northwest Arctic
Borough](/wiki/Northwest_Arctic_Borough,_Alaska "Northwest Arctic Borough,
Alaska") of the U.S. state of [Alaska](/wiki/Alaska "Alaska"). The population
was 309 at the [2010 census](/wiki/United_States_Census,_2010 "United States
Census, 2010").

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 Economy
  * 2 Mining
  * 3 Geography
  * 4 Demographics
  * 5 Transportation
  * 6 References
  * 7 External links

##
Economy[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Economy")]

The [Red Dog mine](/wiki/Red_Dog_mine "Red Dog mine") is the only economic
activity and the mine is the only inhabited site within the Red Dog Mine
CDP.[2]

## Mining[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Mining")]

The Red Dog Mine CDP derives its name from the [Red Dog
mine](/wiki/Red_Dog_mine "Red Dog mine"), the world's largest source for
[zinc](/wiki/Zinc "Zinc") and a significant source of [lead](/wiki/Lead
"Lead").[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] Construction of the Red Dog mine began in 1987,
after exploration revealed that the area was rich in metals.[3][4]

The Red Dog ore body is one of the world's most significant zinc deposits,
containing a number of ore bodies. The mine is located in Alaska's Northwest
Arctic Borough, in the DeLong Mountains of the western Brooks Range, 90 miles
north of Kotzebue and 55 miles from the Chukchi Sea.

At the end of 2007, the site's proven and probable reserves plus indicated
resources amounted to 77.5 million tons, containing 17.5 percent zinc and 4.8
percent lead, as well as 2.8 ounces per ton of silver. In addition, Red Dog
also contains 36.6 million tons of inferred resources. The entire deposit lies
inside a relatively small area (one mile by one-half mile). The deposit is
essentially flat-lying at the surface, making open pit mining the extraction
method of
choice.[[1]](http://www.nana.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=section&id=22&Itemid=275)

##
Geography[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Geography")]

Red Dog Mine is located at [68°04′19″N 162°52′34″W﻿ / ﻿68.071989°N
162.876044°W﻿ / 68.071989;
-162.876044](//tools.wmflabs.org/geohack/geohack.php?pagename=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&params=68.071989_N_-162.876044_E_type:city_region:US).[5]
It is in the DeLong Mountains in the remote western [Brooks
Range](/wiki/Brooks_Range "Brooks Range") about 90 miles (140 km) north of
[Kotzebue](/wiki/Kotzebue,_Alaska "Kotzebue, Alaska") and 55 miles (89 km)
from the [Chukchi Sea](/wiki/Chukchi_Sea "Chukchi Sea").

Red Dog Mine is very isolated. It is located within the Northwest Arctic
Borough, an area approximately the size of Indiana with only 11 communities,
none connected by roads, with a total population of only 7,208 people at the
[2000 census](/wiki/United_States_Census,_2000 "United States Census, 2000").
The nearest of those communities are Noatak, population 428, roughly 50 miles
(80 km) south and Kivalina, population 377, roughly 60 miles (100 km) west at
the 2000 census.[6]

Although native populations have historically used the nearby area for
seasonal food-gathering, there are no permanent residents at the mine or the
port site. The mine's workforce consists of about 460 employees and
contractors, of which somewhat more than half will be on-site at any given
time. At the mine, everyone stays in the single large housing unit, tucked in
among the process buildings near the edge of the open pit, while a small
portion of the work force stays at the port site.[7]

According to the [United States Census
Bureau](/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau "United States Census Bureau"), the
CDP has a total area of 66.9 square miles (173 km2), all land.

##
Demographics[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Demographics")]

As of the [census](/wiki/Census "Census") of 2000,[6] there were 32 people, 0
households, and 0 families residing in the CDP. The population density was 0.5
people per square mile (0.2/km²). There were 0 housing units. The racial
makeup of the CDP was 31.25% [White](/wiki/Race_\(United_States_Census\) "Race
\(United States Census\)"), 65.62% [Native
American](/wiki/Race_\(United_States_Census\) "Race \(United States
Census\)"), and 3.12% from two or more races.

In the CDP, the age distribution of the population shows 18.8% from 18 to 24,
62.5% from 25 to 44, and 18.8% from 45 to 64. The median age was 34 years. For
every 100 females there were 700.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and
over, there were 700.0 males.

The median income for both males and females in the CDP was $0. The [per
capita income](/wiki/Per_capita_income "Per capita income") for the CDP was
$34,438. 37.9% of the population were living below the [poverty
line](/wiki/Poverty_line "Poverty line").

##
Transportation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Red_Dog_Mine,_Alaska&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Transportation")]

A 52-mile (84 km) long haul road connects the mine to the mine's port site on
the Chukchi Sea. The region is accessible only by air, served by the [Red Dog
Airport](/wiki/Red_Dog_Airport "Red Dog Airport"), except during the 100-day
shipping season. Mine workers from remote villages in the region are ferried
to the mine on small aircraft. [Alaska Airlines](/wiki/Alaska_Airlines "Alaska
Airlines") is contracted by the mine to fly other mine workers out of
Anchorage.

qa.question: where is red dog mine located in alaska
qa.answer: ['68°04′19″N 162°52′34″W\ufeff / \ufeff68.071989°N 162.876044°W in the DeLong Mountains in the remote western Brooks Range about 90 miles (140 km) north of Kotzebue and 55 miles (89 km) from the Chukchi Sea.']

triviaqa_40726_14.Query Analysis: The query asks for the specific location of the Red Dog Mine in Alaska, including geographical coordinates and its relation to nearby landmarks.
triviaqa_40726_14.Query Keywords Extraction: Red Dog Mine, located, Alaska, DeLong Mountains, Brooks Range, Kotzebue, Chukchi Sea
triviaqa_40726_14.Answer Analysis: The answer provides precise coordinates (68°04′19″N 162°52′34″W) and describes the mine's location in the DeLong Mountains, about 90 miles north of Kotzebue and 55 miles from the Chukchi Sea.
triviaqa_40726_14.Document Content Analysis: The document discusses zinc isotopes in sphalerite from base metal deposits in the Red Dog district, northern Alaska. It focuses on geological and chemical aspects of the deposits.
triviaqa_40726_14.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document mentions 'Red Dog district' and 'northern Alaska', which are relevant to the query.
triviaqa_40726_14.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document does not mention the specific coordinates or the detailed location relative to Kotzebue and the Chukchi Sea.
triviaqa_40726_14.Key Information Matching: The document references the 'Red Dog district' in 'northern Alaska', which is a partial match to the query's keywords but lacks the specific geographical details provided in the answer.
triviaqa_40726_14.Can the Document Answer the Query: No, the document does not provide the specific location details or coordinates of the Red Dog Mine.
triviaqa_40726_14.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: Yes, the document provides context about the geological significance of the Red Dog district in northern Alaska, which could be useful for understanding the broader region.
